esmModelGrid.description: The grid utilised by the HadAM3/CM3 atmosphere model is based upon a combination of an Arakawa B-grid for horizontal coordinates and a 19-level Lorenz grid for vertical coordinates. Together they define a set of staggered grid locations (nodes) in the horizontal and vertical planes. Grid positions are specified by spherical polar coordinates; that is (lon,lat,r), where r represents a hybrid pressure level. The UM N48 grid is based upon a spherical Earth with a radius 6371229 m. This grid specification defines the locations of P-type and w-type model variables. The locations of the u-type and v-type variables can be derived from the P-grid definition. They are offset one-half of a grid cell to the east and north, respectively, and occur at the same vertical level.

referenceList.reference: Johns,T.C. et al. 1997. The second Hadley Centre coupled ocean-atmosphere GCM: model description, spin-up and validation. Climate Dynamics, vol 13, pp. 103-134.

gridTile.description: The P-grid defines the locations of the scalar (P) variables computed by the model. P locations lie at the centre of the 'grid molecule' used to represent the relative positions of the P, u, v, and w variables.

The W-grid defines the locations of the w-vector quantities computed by the model. The W-grid nodes have the same horizontal location as P-grid nodes but are offset vertically by one-half grid cell (in index space - not necessarily in real-world coordinate space).
